185976611.review:
Games like these make me wish there was an option for a review to be neither negative or positive. 

Gunpoint isn't bad... but it's also not good, for me it leans more good than bad but it has it's issues. The game is short (I did it in 2.8hrs) and I never really felt challenged by any of the puzzles, on the topic of puzzles; they're more akin to chores, they're not that interesting :p. The gameplay could be so, so much better, stealth is basic and the story is... it's there! At least some of the witty lines make up for it.

Pick it up if you like the risk but don't be surprised if you get massively disappointed with the missed opportunity that this game is.

185961473.review:
Um indie bem gostosinho e divertido, tem uma ótima trama e humor, além de puzzles criativos e intuitivos. 

É curtinho, mas o chame está na qualidade da história e a maneira como você lida com ela, além da bela trilha sonora, aquele jazz anos 2000 até 2010, que aparecia em filmes vibe Homem Aranha.

A atmosfera noir é muito boa, e a sensação de solidão por causa da música e ambiente é ótima. Amo como a música me transporta para os anos de 2010 até 2016, aquele sentimento de isolamento por causa do quão a internet e comunicação eram limitados.

Vale muito apena, ainda mais pelo tanto de detalhes que se há com a interação de cenário e maneiras de lidar com os inimigos e situações. Meu arrependimento foi não ter dado a devida atenção quando eu comprei esse joguinho na época, muito único e cheio de personalidade, a começar pela apresentação e conquistas.

185900265.review:
A really decent stealth game, where you hack doors,cameras,sensors to steal data from computers and you are basically insepctor gadget.

another old time classic, and the soundtrack is quite good. One of the first games from suspicious developments and they nailed it. Which lead them to make other games on the genre like [b] Heat Signature, and Tactical Breach Wizards [/b]

A bit of a small game, but it has [b]a level editor[/b] so its technically infinite.

i give this a 10/10.

185885311.review: I wanted to come back and rate this game after playing it so many years ago when I discovered that this was made by the same people who made the recently released Tactical Breach Wizards. Once I saw this I realized the many parallels in the clever, understated humor and writing along with the focus on compact, well developed gameplay loops. This game has all of that, and my only complaint is it's short run time. Even still, I enjoyed the jumping, hacking, great writing, and defenestration so much that I've come back to replay it several times over. 10/10 would recommend.

185872564.review: One of the best games ever made, should be way more popular.

184745166.review:
I expected this game to be full of stealth and action. And it was, but it felt like playing a puzzle game most of the time.
It's also fairly short, but that's a good thing for me, I'm an old man now, can't spend dozens of hours on every game I play.
The writing is superb, great sense of humor, not dissimilar to their later game Heat Signature.
Strongly recommend.

184740933.review: What's the point? Fun, with a capital G.

184608542.review:
For me, getting this game was a leap of faith (pun intended). On the one hand, the creativity of the rewiring mechanic shown in the trailer instantly had me sold on getting this game. On the other hand, part of me was worried that rewiring would be so complicated that it would be hard to learn, hard to use, or both. Fortunately, it's quite the opposite. The rewiring mechanic is intuitive, straight-forward, and it compliments the rest of the abilities perfectly. 

This game is a masterclass in level design. Each level is perfectly crafted to challenge you to be creative and think on your feet. The optional objectives add yet another layer to this, forcing you to be even more creative and find a different way to approach each obstacle. 

Also, the soundtrack is fantastic and fits the spy theme perfectly. When I'm playing well, I really do feel like James Bond.

184579208.review: Played a long time ago and can still remember the fun I had playing it. Worth the money and the time if you want a short and engaging puzzle game. Remember to disable the cameras 📹.

184572242.review: Funny humor, fantastic gameplay, and a nice bite size of a 3(ish) hour experience with good incentive to replay. An indie gem.

184556503.review: It was great for the entire duration i could play (2 hours). I ran into resolution issues with my 2560 x 1440 monitor and could not fix it. Caution for others with similar monitors or bigger.

183904592.review:
Although this product does have some mechanical charm, its lack of content and sophomoric writing hardly justify its $10 price tag. Each level can be completed within a minute and a half and the development team's idea of increasing difficulty is expanding the size of the next level, which allows them to insert more of the same technology to rewire unvariedly. It is no wonder that the most interesting power-up, which is the ability to kick down doors, is only available to players at the end of the game as this would allow originality to levels for which developers intended to be completed as linear and predictable as possible. The best way to describe [i]Gunpoint[/i] is a concept lifted straight from its drafting board and executed in a manner that demonstrates no recognizable innovativeness or any momentous substance for that matter.

It is just another indie game, or grain of sand, in the desert known as the Steam Store.
